speaker: Tomb of Names
lines: You paint a lost name and let the letters dry.
It belongs to someone you remember clearly.
The stone warms in your palm.
You set it back into its gap on the shelf.
A moth lifts from the brush and settles on the wall.
You hear a quiet thank-you in the still air.
Your own name feels steady afterward.
The stairs up look simple enough.

give_item.name: Token of Thanks
give_item.description: A pebble that feels like permission
